intro.value: On November 3, 2012, the band Lake Street Dive was the third act at the Rockwood Music Hall. The 200 person capacity show was headlined by Wes Hutchison, and Noah Gunderson was second bill. “Blah blah blah,” wrote XXX, “Blah Blah Blah.”

Four years later, Lake Street Dive headlined Radio City Music Hall. The band played the hallowed 6,000 person capacity to a near sellout crowd. There could be little doubt that Lake Street Dive had “made it”.
“Blah blah blah” says lead singer XXXX.

made.value: Lake Street Dive’s ascent was improbably. As unlikely as it is get struck by lightning, as a basketball player making 30 3-pointers in a row… They were one of 6,000 acts that opened a concert at a small venue in the New York City area in 2013.
Of those, 3,000 never played another show, 2,000 never played a show beyond 2013.
But some bands do make progress….. 200 bands go on to headline a show in the next three years.
Only 20 bands headline a show above 3,000 capacity.

story.value: Intersperse reference to graphic like above.
